conclusion: Two parallel rails are connected to lamps L₁ (3V, 3W) and L₂ (6V, 6W), a conducting rod with resistance r = 1 Ω moves at constant speed perpendicular to the rails, uniform magnetic field B = 1 T passes vertically through the plane, need to find actual power P₂ of lamp L₂
EMF induced in the moving rod is given by the formula: \( \mathcal{E} = Blv \)
The circuit consists of the moving rod with resistance r = 1 Ω, lamp L₁ with resistance R₁, and lamp L₂ with resistance R₂
Resistance of lamp L₁ is calculated as \( R_1 = \frac{V^2}{P} = 3 \text{ Ω} \)
Resistance of lamp L₂ is calculated as \( R_2 = \frac{V^2}{P} = 6 \text{ Ω} \)
Current flowing through the circuit when L₁ operates normally is \( I = 1 \text{ A} \)
Rod's velocity is calculated as \( v = 16.67 \text{ m/s} \)
Voltage across lamp L₂ is \( V_2 = 6 \text{ V} \)
Actual power of lamp L₂ is \( P_2 = 6 \text{ W} \)
Final answer is that the actual power P₂ of lamp L₂ is 6 W, meaning lamp L₂ is operating at its rated specifications
